snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry told the Egyptian authorities on Sunday that they would not be able to defeat terrorism at home unless they showed greater respect for human rights.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry, during visit to Egypt, says that country will not be able to root out terrorism at home until it shows greater respect for civil rights of its citizens; Kerry says United States will nonetheless increase security cooperation with Egypt and is moving toward resuming Bright Star, joint military operation that had been cancelled following August 2013 crackdown on supporters of Mohamed Morsi.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry told the Egyptian authorities on Sunday that they would not be able to defeat terrorism at home unless they showed greater respect for human rights.

headline.main: Kerry Warns Egypt Human Rights Abuses Can Hurt Fight Against Terrorism
headline.print_headline: Kerry Warns Egypt Human Rights Abuses Can Hurt Fight Against Terrorism

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
